alert.note: Alert for Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Boyd, northwestern Lawrence, southeastern Carter and northwestern Wayne Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grayson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grayson, Grayson Lake State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Cannonsburg, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Webbville, Princess, Durbin, Coalton, Denton, Burnaugh, Centerville, Rush, Lockwood, Willard, Hitchins, Buchanan and Fallsburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 168 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
